poem:
Title: "A Prayer for Gaza"

With hollowed eyes of Gazan plight,
Incrusted with war's ash and night.
A voice, faint, pleads in abating breath,
Beneath the gripping cleats of death.

Seeking solace in no-man's land,
To all, a plea; a stretched-out hand.
These leaders in their towers so high,
Heed the cry before hope's sigh.

And by peace, may love's decree,
Bend them to a penitent knee.
